Grant Name: ANDHealth+ Digital & Connected Health Accelerator (Intake 1)
Administering Body: ANDHealth Pty Ltd (supported by MRFF BioMedTech Incubator)
Grant Purpose: Non-dilutive project funding and hands-on commercialisation support to scale evidence-based digital and connected health SMEs via a two-stage program with milestone-tranched funding.
Requirements: Apply via Gust; two-stage (Stage 1 and Stage 2) with milestone plan; selection by multi-sector advisory panel; open date 2025-09-02.
Eligibility Criteria: Australian SMEs developing evidence-based digital or connected health technologies; see program page for detailed eligibility.
Web Link: Two-stage application with project plan, milestones, attachments.
notes: digital health, AI, SME, TRL5-8, clinical evidence
column16: Applications open 2025-09-02; close 2026-01-16. Milestone-tranched funding up to $5m.

Grant Name: 2025 BHI Conference Support Grants
Administering Body: The Hospital Research Foundation Group (Basil Hetzel Institute for Translational Health Research)
Grant Purpose: Support BHI‑affiliated staff and HDR students with some costs of conference participation (local, national, international).
Requirements: Apply after conference participation and lodge within the relevant assessment cycle via SmartyGrants.
Eligibility Criteria: BHI‑affiliated staff and Higher Degree by Research (HDR) students; see scheme guidelines for full eligibility.
Web Link: Short form via SmartyGrants; assessment cycles.
column16: Rolling assessment cycles in 2025; see scheme guidelines for timelines.

Grant Name: AEA Ignite (Round 3, expected early 2026)
Administering Body: Australia’s Economic Accelerator (Department of Education)
Grant Purpose: Early‑stage research commercialisation grants to establish proof‑of‑concept in an industry‑relevant environment.
Requirements: Follows AEA timelines; Round 3 expected to open early 2026; check scheme page for updates.
Eligibility Criteria: Researchers at Australian universities; industry engagement expected; see AEA guidelines.
Web Link: Standard competitive grants via AEA; details to be released for Round 3.
column16: Round 2 closed 2025-09-03; Round 3 expected to open early 2026 per scheme page.

Grant Name: MRFF – 2025 Targeted Translation Research Accelerator – Cardiovascular Disease and Diabetes Risk Prediction and Data Solutions
Administering Body: NHMRC on behalf of Australian Government Department of Health and Aged Care (MRFF)
Grant Purpose: Supports projects to identify predictive markers in diabetes/cardiovascular disease (Stream 1) and to harness existing data infrastructures to develop new prevention/treatment approaches (Stream 2).
Funding Amount: Stream 1: $0.25–1.0 million (up to 2 years); Stream 2: up to $2.5 million (up to 5 years)
Requirements: Apply via Sapphire/GrantConnect; two streams.
Eligibility Criteria: MRFF-eligible administering organisations; Stream 2 requires the organisation undertaking the majority of research to be in MM2–7, with CI-A, ≥50% of CIs and all participants resident in MM2–7 ≥12 months prior to close.
Web Link: Full MRFF application via Sapphire; templates and RAO approvals required.
notes: AI, data, cardiovascular, diabetes, registries, RRR, TRL5-8, clinical
column16: Funding ranges confirmed from university research office page; see guidelines on GrantConnect.

Grant Name: MRFF – 2025 Targeted Translation Research Accelerator – Cardiovascular Disease and Diabetes Models of Care
Administering Body: NHMRC on behalf of Australian Government Department of Health and Aged Care (MRFF)
Grant Purpose: Large-scale, multidisciplinary projects to co-design, implement and validate technology-augmented, patient-centred models of care for CVD and/or diabetes.
Requirements: Apply via Sapphire/GrantConnect; two streams; topics include general, RRR (MM2–7), First Nations health, and CALD focus.
Eligibility Criteria: MRFF-eligible administering organisations; topic-specific conditions apply (e.g., RRR residency for Topic B).
Web Link: Full MRFF application via Sapphire; templates and RAO approvals required.
notes: digital health, models of care, CVD, diabetes, implementation, TRL5-8

Grant Name: MRFF – 2025 Research Data Infrastructure
Administering Body: Australian Government Department of Health and Aged Care (MRFF)
Grant Purpose: Funds creation/extension of national research data infrastructure (registries, biobanks, linkage platforms) to enable and enhance Australian medical research.
Requirements: Guidelines available via GrantConnect; focus on strategic investments in data infrastructure.
Web Link: GrantConnect application (administered by NHMRC); MRFF processes apply.
notes: data infrastructure, registries, linkage, AI, synthetic data
column16: Program totals noted in MRFF communications; per‑grant caps not always stated publicly.

Grant Name: MRFF – 2025 Genomics Health Futures
Administering Body: NHMRC on behalf of Australian Government Department of Health and Aged Care (MRFF)
Grant Purpose: Supports pharmacogenomics (Stream 1) and genomics to optimise diagnosis/treatment/prevention for priority diseases among Aboriginal and/or Torres Strait Islander peoples (Stream 2).
Requirements: Apply via Sapphire/GrantConnect; stream/topic selection required.
Eligibility Criteria: MRFF-eligible administering organisations; stream-specific criteria apply.
Web Link: Full MRFF application via Sapphire; templates and RAO approvals required.
notes: genomics, pharmacogenomics, Indigenous health, bioinformatics, AI, TRL4-8
column16: Per-grant ranges commonly provided on university research office pages; deadlines from MRFF calendar.

Grant Name: MRFF – 2025 Maternal Health and Healthy Lifestyles
Administering Body: NHMRC on behalf of Australian Government Department of Health and Aged Care (MRFF)
Grant Purpose: Supports research to improve prevention and management of perinatal mental ill-health, healthy early childhood development, and preventive health approaches for adolescents, young adults and middle-aged people.
Requirements: Apply via Sapphire/GrantConnect.
Eligibility Criteria: MRFF-eligible administering organisations.
Web Link: Full MRFF application via Sapphire; templates and RAO approvals required.
notes: public health, prevention, maternal health, youth, TRL2-6

Grant Purpose: Invites successful NIHR Stage 2 platform studies (closing 2025-11-27) to apply for MRFF or NHMRC funding in Q2 2026.

Administering Body: National Health and Medical Research Council (NHMRC)
Grant Purpose: Supports high-quality clinical trials and cohort studies to deliver implementable findings that improve health outcomes and practice/policy.

Grant Name: NHMRC – Centres of Research Excellence (CRE) 2026
Administering Body: National Health and Medical Research Council (NHMRC)
Grant Purpose: Funds teams to pursue collaborative research and build capacity in basic, clinical, health services and public health research.
Requirements: Apply via NHMRC Sapphire; minimum data due 2025-10-29; streams across four areas.
Eligibility Criteria: NHMRC Administering Institutions; see scheme guidelines.
Web Link: Full NHMRC application via Sapphire; peer review.
notes: collaborative research, CRE, capacity building, TRL2-7

Grant Name: NHMRC – Global Alliance for Chronic Diseases (GACD): Strengthening Health Systems Funding Call 2025
Administering Body: National Health and Medical Research Council (NHMRC) with GACD
Grant Purpose: Implementation research to strengthen health systems to improve equity in care/outcomes for NCDs in LMICs and underserved populations; for NHMRC funding in HICs, focus must be on Aboriginal and/or Torres Strait Islander communities.
Requirements: Two-stage call via GACD Portal; shortlisted Australia-based applicants submit to NHMRC Sapphire at Stage 2.
Eligibility Criteria: Australia-based applicants via NHMRC; projects in LMICs and/or underserved populations; specific focus required for HICs as above.
Web Link: Two-stage international + NHMRC application.
notes: health systems, implementation, LMIC, Indigenous health, TRL4-7

Grant Name: FHRI Fund Distinguished Fellows 2025–26
Administering Body: Future Health Research and Innovation (FHRI) Fund, WA Department of Health
Grant Purpose: Attracts outstanding interstate/international research leaders to relocate to WA to build WA-led globally recognised research programs.
Requirements: Relocation to WA; salary support for Fellow and team, direct research funding and relocation costs.
Eligibility Criteria: International or interstate senior research leaders appointable at academic Level C/D/E or equivalent clinical level.
Web Link: Expression-of-interest style process; rolling acceptance; GMS form to be published.
column16: Program status: Open; ‘Applicants may apply at any time’.

Grant Name: 2025 Innovative Research in Precision Medicine (WA)
Administering Body: The Hospital Research Foundation Group with FHRI Fund Co‑Funding Partnerships Program
Grant Purpose: Supports innovative precision medicine projects led by early‑to‑mid‑career researchers in WA across cancer, mental health, musculoskeletal, cardiovascular and neurodegenerative conditions.
Funding Amount: Tier 1: up to $125,000 over 2 years; Tier 2 seed: $25,000
Requirements: EOI via SmartyGrants by 4:00pm (AWST) 29 Oct 2025; templates provided.
Eligibility Criteria: ECR/MCR at Eligible Administering Institutions in WA; see guidelines for definitions.
Web Link: EOI stage; shortlisted to full application.
notes: precision medicine, genomics, digital health, WA, ECR/MCR, TRL3-6

Grant Name: Tom Simpson Trust Fund (SA)
Administering Body: Heart Foundation (South Australia)
Grant Purpose: Supports cardiac care research in South Australia through provision of research equipment grants.
Requirements: Apply via Heart Foundation Grants Management Portal; travel must occur 2026 if applicable.
Eligibility Criteria: SA-based early‑career researchers (<10 years), cardiac-focus; future expenditure only.
Web Link: Short online application; single closing date.

Grant Name: WA Cystic Fibrosis Research Collaborative Program – Stream 1: Postgraduate Top‑Up Scholarships (final 2025 round)
Administering Body: FHRI Fund (with Cystic Fibrosis Western Australia)
Grant Purpose: Top‑up scholarships to support postgraduate research within the WA CF Research Collaborative.
Requirements: Apply via CF WA (external) by 1:00pm (AWST) 31 Oct 2025.
Eligibility Criteria: WA-based CF postgraduate researchers as per program rules.
Web Link: Short application to CF WA.
column16: Listed on FHRI Fund ‘Current opportunities’ with closing date and external link.

Grant Name: Wellcome Early‑Career Awards (international)
Administering Body: Wellcome Trust
Grant Purpose: Funds early‑career researchers to develop their research identity and deliver advances in life, health and wellbeing; includes salary and research costs.
Requirements: Three rounds/year; apply via Wellcome Funding system; sponsor/mentor required.
Eligibility Criteria: Administering organisation must be in UK, Republic of Ireland or a low‑/middle‑income country; Australian applicants eligible if hosted at an eligible non‑Australian institution.
Web Link: Two-stage internal/external reviews; guidance-driven process.
notes: international, early-career, discovery, global health, data/AI (eligible), TRL1-4
column16: Australians can apply if hosted at eligible organisations outside Australia (UK/ROI/LMIC).
